snippet: The deal to pay $3.6 billion for airwaves owned by Time Warner Cable, Comcast, Cox Communications and Bright House Networks still needs approval from the Federal Communications Commission
abstract: The deal to pay $3.6 billion for airwaves owned by Time Warner Cable, Comcast, Cox Communications and Bright House Networks still needs approval from the Federal Communications Commission

headline.main: Justice Dept. Approves, With Changes, Verizon Wireless Spectrum Purchase
